key_channel_insights.line_content: More than half of itineraries price higher on OTAs (+3 % average), with Taiwan routes showing an 82 % higher-fare rate, threatening local price perception.
MSEs undercut the airline in 88 % of searches, albeit by a tiny –0.1 % average, signalling volume-driven leakage rather than deep discounting.
GDS prices exceed web levels on 77 % of itineraries (+3 %), especially on short haul (88 %), exposing managed-travel customers to systematic premiums.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: 52.5 % of itineraries carried a 3 % OTA premium last week.
Exact-price parity held at 40 %, but OTA-higher share rose +7.5 ppts MoM.
TW-origin routes were OTA-higher 81.8 % of the time, vs 23.9 % ex-TW.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: ‘Offer not found’ on OTAs dropped to 2.2 %, a two-thirds WoW reduction.
Parity steady at 40.3 %, up 1.2 ppts WoW.
OTA-higher cases now 52.5 %, +1.8 ppts WoW; average premium 3 %.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: OTAs priced higher on 55.3 % of short-haul routes, vs 4.4 % undercuts.
Long-haul split: 48.6 % parity, 44.4 % OTA-higher, 3 % average premium.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Only 0.3 % parity; 81.8 % higher on OTAs (+11 ppts MoM).
74.6 % parity, demonstrating price discipline outside the home market.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 49.5 % OTA-higher, a 10 ppt MoM jump; discounts limited to 7 % of fares.
59 % OTA-higher; early shoppers face a persistent 3–4 % markup.

mse_highlights.line_content: MSE priced below web on 87.8 % of itineraries last week.
Lower-fare share up +3.9 ppts WoW; parity shrinking to 12 %.
Average undercut just –0.10 %, indicating sensitivity to even small web mark-ups.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: 100 % of web fares present on MSEs; no visibility gaps.
Identical pricing on only 11.9 % of itineraries (-4 ppts WoW).
87.8 % cheaper on MSE; discount depth stable at –0.10 %.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: 90.8 % of short-haul itineraries cheaper on MSE (–11 % avg discount).
Long-haul undercut share at 77.8 %; parity improved to 22.2 %.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Lower-fare frequency dipped to 86.0 %; slight rise in higher-fare sightings.
Lower-fare share jumped to 89.4 %, cutting parity to 10.6 %.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 85.9 % cheaper 60 + days out; first 1.1 % higher-fare cases recorded.

gds_highlights.line_content: 77 % of itineraries higher-priced in GDS, averaging a 3 % markup.
88 % higher on short haul; when lower (9 %) GDS undercuts by 28 %.
85 % higher for far-out bookings; no discounts recorded.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: 100 % web fares found in GDS; zero availability gaps.
Only 15 % parity, flat WoW and MoM.
77 % higher in GDS; 3 % average premium, essentially stable.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: 88 % higher with 3 % markup; lower-fare share up 1.4 ppts WoW.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 85 % higher with 3 % premium; discounts at 10 % share.
69 % higher, 25 % parity; 6 % lower with –36 % deepest discounts.
